sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: New records mean new restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As Europe battles a surge in coronavirus infections, Italy and Austria enforce tighter measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin continues his appeal, urging NATO to withdraw its membership offer to Ukraine during his annual press conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As Russia continues to amass troops on Ukraine's border, soldiers in the former Soviet Republic practice drills in case Moscow launches an attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: France registered a record-breaking 91,608 new coronavirus infections on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That's the highest number of daily cases the country has seen since the pandemic began. In response, Health Minister Olivier Véran says measures to fight the disease are likely to increase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: OLIVIER VÉRAN, Minister for Health and Welfare of France Very clearly, France is experiencing what all countries affected by this extremely contagious Omicron variant are experiencing. I had talked about 100,000 positive cases per day between Christmas and New Year's Eve, but we might actually reach this level closer to Christmas than to the new year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And in the UK, the infection rate is showing no sign of slowing down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Over 119,000 people tested positive to the virus in the past 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: While a hospital admission is less likely for someone with Omicron, the variant is spreading fast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Of course, with this very, very rapid rise and increase in cases, and we've seen the national cases go above 100,000, then of course, more cases means more pressure because even though a smaller proportion might get severe disease or go to hospital, that could still result in many cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And of course, that could give pressure on the health service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Moving south, cases in Italy have risen above 44,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That's an 8,000 case increase in the space of a day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The health ministry also calculated another 168 coronavirus-related deaths.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Following an emergency government meeting, nightclubs will shut until January 31st and masks in outdoor public spaces will once again become mandatory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile all foreigners arriving in Czech Republic will have to display a negative PCR test from Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And across to Austria, arrivals from the UK, Norway, Denmark and the Netherlands must present a negative PCR test and proof of the booster jab from Christmas Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Beijing Winter Olympics organisers strongly suggest athletes from abroad should receive COVID-19 booster shots before participating in the Games as the new Omicron variant takes hold across the world. The decision was taken following talks between China and the International Olympic Committee. We have repeatedly communicated with the International Olympic Committee and reached a consensus that given the uncertainty of the covet 19 situation as well as the spread of the new variant omicron around the world we strongly suggest that all athletes and other stakeholders receive booster shots before coming to china many countries have positively responded to that and given booster shots to their athletes." During the Games, all athletes, staff and journalists will be confined to bubbles for the duration of the competition, which will take place at three far-flung locations in downtown Beijing. China maintains some of the world's strictest antivirus travel restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has urged the West yet again to block Ukraine from joining NATO in an annual press conference on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Membership would allow the military alliance deploy weapons in the former Soviet Republic. This comes as Russia continues to amass troops on the border with Ukraine. In a bid to protect the Kremlin's security interests, the leader will begin negotiations with US officials in Geneva next month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Without any tricks, we put it straight. There should be no NATO expansion eastward. The ball is in their court. They need to provide us with some answers. During a conference call with the US President earlier in December, Joe Biden warned that Russia will face severe consequences if it invades Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: However, Putin wants to also ensure that the Nord Stream 2 pipeline project will be protected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There is no need to destroy long-term contracts, but no, we were told by the European Commission we need to move to market relations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So more than $2,000 per 1,000 cubic meters of gas has been regulated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While this meeting with the U.S. is a positive step for Putin, the president maintains that the West is brainwashing the Ukrainian people and is pushing an anti-Russian narrative as tensions continue to build. does not want a conflict with Ukraine, but it needs security guarantees immediately and

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: unconditionally. The Russian president also said that NATO had tricked Russia, which brought, as he underlined, to five waves of expansion. And he said that he was looking forward to the talks between Russia and the U.S. scheduled on the beginning of the next year in Geneva. Mr. Putin also said that Gazprom had no intentions of undermining the gas supplies to Europe and he was asked about the opposition figure, the imprisoned Alexei Navalny. Mr. Putin did not mention Mr. Navalny by his name as usual and said that Russia was still waiting for any proof of his poisoning from the West. Путин не упоминал его имени, как обычно, и сказал, что Россия ждет любых доказательств его пояснения с Восточной.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Было больше доместных вопросов в этой пресс-конференции.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: И я чувствовала, что мистер Путин предпочитает говорить о том, что происходит внутри России.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Например, он был спросил о эффекте пандемии на экономику, и он сказал, что Россия делает очень хорошо, гораздо лучше, чем некоторые другие страны. Г the pandemic on the economy, and he said that Russia did pretty well, much better than some other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews, from Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The countdown to liftoff is upon us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The highly anticipated launch of NASA's giant new James Webb Space Telescope on Saturday promises to look deeper into the universe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Scientists are hoping its state-of-the-art capabilities will allow them to study the atmospheres of distant planets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They're also hoping for signs of life to be detected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Well, for more on this, I'm now joined by Dr. Francisco Diego, who is an astronomer at the University College London. Thank you for joining us, Dr. Diego, who is an astronomer at the University College London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Thank you for joining us, Dr Diego.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This launch has faced many obstacles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Can you talk us through what we can expect when it does take off?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It is perhaps one of the most impressive scientific experiments ever attempted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This telescope, both from the technology that is behind it, the design, the materials, everything, plus the kind of work that it's going to do in the next few years is amazing, it's completely astonishing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: How can it give us a better understanding of our Universe and our space in it? The observing in the in the middle infrared, the James Webb is going to be able to observe the formation, the very first stars in the universe. We're talking more than 13,000 million years ago, 30,000 million years ago, just after the formation of the universe, when the first stars emerge, the formation of galaxies in the cosmological part of the science that is going to do, plus the formation of stars in general in our Milky Way galaxy, the formation of planets, the formation of solar systems, which is extremely important, and also the characterization of the conditions of the planets that we already know.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Alien planets around the nearby stars characterize their atmospheres, characterize their composition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And the James Webb is going to have a perfect opportunity to do this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Small is beautiful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That's the name of Europe's first miniature art exhibition in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This widely anticipated display boasts the work of 20 creatives from all over the world, where attention to detail is paramount.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Fans of this mini-phenomenon, which rose to popularity on social media, can immerse themselves in 126 photographs and installations spread across two floors at Gallery Josef. Artists have fashioned the most unlikely objects bringing their childhood imaginations back to life inside a number of small-scale universes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Suitable for all ages the dimensions serve as a reminder of the skill and patience required to invent these bespoke and often wacky pieces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On show until January 13th, the miniature art exhibition also offers creative workshops for children, which is stay with us as we bring you all the latest from across Europe and beyond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And you can find more on our website, euronews.com.
